result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jospeh Roman Infante

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Jospeh Roman Infante in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
Justice Point Discharge Report forwarded to the Judge for review and filed.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($500.00 signature bond) LW
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
Court ordered all conditions of bail to remain in effect.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Jospeh Roman Infante in court.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 10., Judge Havas.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case iin court for a calendar call.  Defendant does not appear.  Court issued a bench warrant.  Court forfeited $500.00 PR bond.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Due to courtwide zoom issues, Court waives defendant's appearance for today's Court date.  Defense counsel advises Court of possible DPA resolution.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jospeh Roman Infante in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jospeh Roman Infante appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Victim appeared by zoom.  Defense counsel needs offer and discovery and requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  
Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Defendant had called the clerk and informed her he could not get on Zoom.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  State informed the Court this case should be tabbed to Br. 10.  Case is adjourned to Br. 10.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST:

received and filed.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jospeh Roman Infante in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Jospeh Roman Infante in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jospeh Roman Infante appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.
This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
